events.comment:
In this example, the animation of the character is accelerating over time as the player accelerate and deccelerating as the player deccelerate to create smooth movement and make the animation speed match the speed of the movement
The "Player" object has an automatism called "Platformer object": 
You can move it using the arrows key and the Shift key to jump.

The platforms are recognized thanks to their "Platform" automatism.
events.comment2:
L'objet "Player" poss�de un automatisme appel� "Personnage d�pla�able sur les plateformes":
Vous pouvez le bouger avec les fl�ches directionnelles et utiliser la touche Shift ( ou Maj ) pour sauter.

Les plateformes ont toutes un automatisme "Plateforme" afin d'�tre reconnues comme telles.

events.comment: At the beginning, set speed scale of player to 1 which is normal and initialize player_state variable which is used to store the actual state of the player
hide the touch controls if the game is running on a PC
Chage the postition of the character on the X axis when get to the boxes to make it able to run and accelerate forever similar to an infinite runner
Change the animation according to what the player do.
events.comment2: On change l'animation en fonction de ce que fait le joueur.

events.comment: Move the player using the keyboard
If left key is pressed, but the player is moving to the right, slow it down first
if the player stopped, flip it and move it to the left

If the player state is to move left, We use a timer to know the time elapsed since the beginning of the movement. Then, we use this time to determine the speed of the player (and update the animation speed scale to accelerate the animation)
events.comment2: On utilise un chronom�tre pour conna�tre le temps �coul� depuis le d�but du mouvement du personnage. Ensuite, on utilise ce temps pour d�terminer la vitesse du personnage (et mettre � jour l'�chelle de vitesse de l'animation du personnage).

if the player stopped, frlip it and move it to the right

If the player state is to move right, We use a timer to know the time elapsed since the beginning of the movement. Then, we use this time to determine the speed of the player (and update the animation speed scale to accelerate the animation)

events.comment: Move the player using the on-screen buttons, it is visible only if the game is running on a mobile device
If left button is pressed, but the player is moving to the right, slow it down first
if the player stopped, flip it and move it to the left

If the player state is to move left, We use a timer to know the time elapsed since the beginning of the movement. Then, we use this time to determine the speed of the player (and update the animation speed scale to accelerate the animation)

events.comment: Jump if the jump button is down
If the movement keys and pointer is not pressed but the player is moving, decrease the speed scale of the animation as the player deccelerating
in case the keys are not pressed and the player is also not moving, set the player state to idle which has no real purpose at the momen but can be useful in case you build on the top of this
Make sure the camera follows the player.
events.comment2: On s'assure que la cam�ra suit le joueur.
